private_information: I can move one disk at a time between pegs
I must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
I know the initial configuration of the disks on the pegs
disk_mover.goal: Move the entire stack from the left peg to the right peg following the rules

private_information: I can verify configurations against the rules
I know the target goal configuration
validator.goal: Confirm the goal configuration is correctly specified and reachable under the rules

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left middle and right
There are five disks labeled A B C D E from smallest A to largest E
Only one disk may be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration has left peg top to bottom A B C D E and the other pegs empty
Goal configuration has right peg top to bottom A B C D E and the other pegs empty

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that describes the initial state and the legal move operations in human readable form without producing PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is disk_mover. Use the public information and your private knowledge to produce a concise human readable description of the initial tower configuration and all legal single-disk move actions and constraints. Do not output PDDL. Provide any assumptions clearly.

check.system_prompt: You are an agent that validates the goal specification and rule consistency and reports verification notes in human readable form without producing PDDL.
check.prompt: Your name is validator. Use the public information and your private knowledge to confirm that the goal configuration is correctly specified and reachable under the rules and to list any validation notes. Do not output PDDL. Provide any assumptions clearly.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling for the FastDownward planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that model three pegs and five disks and that solve the specified Tower of Hanoi instance using standard predicates and actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownward compatibility and ensure types predicates and action definitions are appropriate for that planner.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate the human readable descriptions from disk_mover and validator and the public information to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieve the global goal of moving the stack from left to right. Use disk names A B C D E and peg names left middle right. Think step by step and output the PDDL domain and problem only as specified, ensuring compatibility with the FastDownward solver.
